body:
Thanks for raising the issue.

We'll look into it.

rename.from: Springboot and @TestInstance(TestInstance.Lifecycle.PER_CLASS) results in threading issues for class fields initialized in BeforeEach.
rename.to: Springboot and @TestInstance(PER_CLASS) results in threading issues for class fields initialized in @BeforeEach method

rename.from: Springboot and @TestInstance(PER_CLASS) results in threading issues for class fields initialized in @BeforeEach method
rename.to: Spring Boot and @TestInstance(PER_CLASS) results in threading issues for class fields initialized in @BeforeEach method

body: Out of curiosity, why don't you have `junit5.platform.version` set to `1.3.0-M1` instead of `1.2.0`?
@dlanaghen `@TestInstance(PER_CLASS)` is not "Needed for BeforeAll", only if you want your `@BeforeAll` methods to be not `static`.

I realize that, but I had put that notation in a base test class because some of my other classes might need that and I saw no reason not to just include it in my base class.  
This is not going to be problem currently for us, but I thought I would report my finding.

- Dave

rename.from: Spring Boot and @TestInstance(PER_CLASS) results in threading issues for class fields initialized in @BeforeEach method
rename.to: Parallel execution and @TestInstance(PER_CLASS) result in threading issues for instance fields initialized in @BeforeEach method

body:
This is actually not related to Spring Boot.

I have therefore renamed this issue accordingly.
